title: Show us your shirt
content:
Post a pic of you in your [Typophile tees](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216005449/http:/typophile.bigcartel.com/)! (Or a pic of someone else is even better.)

Yeah, that's me. Trying to prove I can still fakey.  
 [![Yes! I can still fakey](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216005449im_/http:/farm2.static.flickr.com/1210/907698772_dee0332acf.jpg)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216005449/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/joepemberton/907698772/ "Photo Sharing")
author: Joe Pemberton

comments.content:
[me in the newest typo t](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216005449/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/pauldhunt/1024628597/) posing with the lovely mrs. tiffany

it looks great, Christian!

Or, embedded here: ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216005449im_/http:/farm2.static.flickr.com/1416/1024628597_6d21eb0c53.jpg)

And Paul, there's this one too: [![Paul, Tiffany, Miguel](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216005449im_/http:/farm2.static.flickr.com/1023/1006435632_c5f30168f6.jpg)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216005449/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/joepemberton/1006435632/ "Photo Sharing")
my sister actually accused me of never wearing anything besides typo tees. :^p
Looking hip at the dealership having my car hot-wired for my iPod in my Simonson script T. Note the battle I'm having trying to keep my upper body at least as big as my stomach

Paul,  
Maybe she is right about that? :-P

ChrisL
I found a similar thread from 2005, [Typophile tshirts in the wild](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216005449/http:/typophile.com/node/9270).

The Call of Cthulhu director Andrew Leman is a Typophile.

[![The Call of Cthulhu director...](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216005449im_/http:/farm3.static.flickr.com/2005/1911643965_d953ce0789.jpg)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130216005449/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/joepemberton/1911643965/ "Photo Sharing")
Joe, that still looks just like J.H. and T.F-J. from the _Helvetica_ movie!
Andi, way to bring this thread back to life.
Andi, just curious: has anybody ever stopped you on the street to ask what your t-shirt says or means? I have that one too, and I've had at least two people ask me on the subway! :-D

Ricardo, I have that shirt also, and people regularly ask about it when I wear it. To me it's the best Typophile shirt (and not a winner!) because it's a design that relates to the body well, as apparel, and sparks conversation. Unless you don't want that, because people will ask!

Thanks, William. I guess the reason is that it's slightly more cryptic (to an outsider) than "California Job Case" or "Anatomy of an A"! Although one guy thought the California Job Case design had to do with architecture. :-)
Say, I think we need new shirts now. I need one for the holidays!
